comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.17) Gecko/20110414 Thunderbird/3.1.10

If the penultimate line of a paragraph ends with italic text, and you try to enter italic text at the end of the following line, the cursor jumps back up so that the new text is instead appended to the end of the previous line.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new composition window
2. Write "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet conspicatur sunt"
3. Italicise "sit amet" 
4. Resize the window such that "conspicatur" wraps to a new line
5. Place the cursor at the end of "sunt"
6. Turn on italic text
7. Type "foo"

Actual Results:  
"foo" is appended to the end of "amet"

Expected Results:  
"foo" should be appended to the end of "sunt"

The same effect occurs with bold and underline, and bold-underline, but not when the formatting does not match (eg bold-underline for the first line and only underline for the second).  The effect is generally repeatable with the same block of text, but sometimes it stops exhibiting the behaviour; erasing to before the end of the first line and rewriting causes the effect to reappear with the same window.  The bug occurs with all extensions disabled.
